why_path: ANM (Auxiliary Nurse Midwifery) is a 2-year diploma program ideal for those passionate about healthcare and community service. ANM nurses work in primary health centers, rural health facilities, maternity homes, and provide basic nursing care, maternal and child health services, immunization, and health education. This career offers job security in government health departments and opportunities in private clinics and hospitals.
what_to_study: During the 2-year ANM program, you'll study nursing fundamentals, anatomy and physiology, nutrition, community health nursing, midwifery, child health, and health center management. The curriculum includes practical training in hospitals and community health centers.

roadmap.description: Complete Class 10, choose Creative/Service Skills stream variant
Complete ANM 2-year diploma with clinical training in maternal and child health
Register with State Nursing Council, work as ANM in PHCs, rural health centers, or maternity homes
Upgrade to GNM (bridge course) or B.Sc Nursing, specialize in midwifery or community health

why_path: GNM (General Nursing & Midwifery) is a 3-year diploma program that prepares you to become a professional staff nurse in hospitals, clinics, and healthcare facilities. GNM nurses provide comprehensive patient care, assist doctors during procedures, manage wards, administer medications, and support patient recovery. This career offers excellent job opportunities in both government and private hospitals, with potential for specialization and career advancement.
what_to_study: During the 3-year GNM program, you'll study advanced nursing fundamentals, medical-surgical nursing, anatomy and physiology, pharmacology, microbiology, psychology, community health nursing, pediatric nursing, and obstetrics & gynecology. The curriculum includes extensive clinical rotations in hospital departments and hands-on patient care training.

roadmap.description: Complete Class 10, choose Creative/Service Skills stream variant
Complete GNM 3-year diploma with clinical training across all hospital departments
Register with State/Indian Nursing Council, work as Staff Nurse in hospitals or clinics
Pursue B.Sc Nursing (bridge course), specialize in ICU/OT/Emergency, or advance to nursing management roles

why_path: Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) typically follows courses like Emergency Medical Technician (EMT) and focuses on healthcare/emergency work in private/government sector.
what_to_study: Subjects and courses: Emergency Medical Technician (EMT). Key skills include those listed in the career profile.

roadmap.short_term: CREATIVE_SERVICE_SKILLS background, Prepare for relevant entrance exams
roadmap.long_term: Work as Emergency Medical Technician (EMT), gain experience, consider specialization or higher studies

short_description: A career in healthcare/emergency focusing on professional growth in private/government organizations.

why_path: IT Support Technician / Helpdesk typically follows courses like NSQF IT / Digital Basics and focuses on it/support work in private sector.
what_to_study: Subjects and courses: NSQF IT / Digital Basics. Key skills include those listed in the career profile.

roadmap.short_term: TECHNICAL_SKILLS background, Prepare for relevant entrance exams
roadmap.mid_term: Complete NSQF IT / Digital Basics (typically 3-4 years)
roadmap.long_term: Work as IT Support Technician / Helpdesk, gain experience, consider specialization or higher studies

short_description: A career in it/support focusing on professional growth in private organizations.
